newsitem.title: DUBAI: PRESS DIGEST - United Arab Emirates - Oct 22.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - United Arab Emirates - Oct 22.

text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the United Arab Emirates press on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- First batch of French forces arrive in the UAE for joint military exercises.
The UAE and France are tied by a defence pact.
- New and pending Dubai road projects to cost over one billion dirhams.
- Qatar emir to name heir apparent.
- UAE Central Bank governor urges senior policymakers to avoid future shocks by developing a friendly dialogue with the business community before introducing changes in an amnesty law.

As many as 200,000 foreign workers, mainly from the Indian subcontinent, are scrambling to leave the country under a government amnesty which gives them until October 31 to get their papers in order or get out.
- New regulatory authority to oversee the operation of the proposed official UAE stock exchange.
